4638 
4639  /*!
4640  @brief calculates the extra space to escape a JSON string
4641 
4642  @param[in] s the string to escape
4643  @return the number of characters required to escape string @a s
4644 
4645  @complexity Linear in the length of string @a s.
4646  */
4647  static std::size_t extra_space(const string_t& s) noexcept
4648  {
4649  std::size_t result = 0;
4650 
4651  for (const auto& c : s)
4652  {
4653  switch (c)
4654  {
4655  case '"':
4656  case '\\':
4657  case '\b':
4658  case '\f':
4659  case '\n':
4660  case '\r':
4661  case '\t':
4662  {
4663  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
4664  result += 1;
4665  break;
4666  }
4667 
4668  default:
4669  {
4670  if (c >= 0x00 and c <= 0x1f)
4671  {
4672  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
4673  result += 5;
4674  }
4675  break;
4676  }
4677  }
4678  }
4679 
4680  return result;
4681  }
4682 
4683  /*!
4684  @brief escape a string
4685 
4686  Escape a string by replacing certain special characters by a sequence of an
4687  escape character (backslash) and another character and other control
4688  characters by a sequence of "\u" followed by a four-digit hex
4689  representation.
4690 
4691  @param[in] s the string to escape
4692  @return the escaped string
4693 
4694  @complexity Linear in the length of string @a s.
4695  */
4696  static string_t escape_string(const string_t& s) noexcept
4697  {
4698  const auto space = extra_space(s);
4699  if (space == 0)
4700  {
4701  return s;
4702  }
4703 
4704  // create a result string of necessary size
4705  string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
4706  std::size_t pos = 0;
4707 
4708  for (const auto& c : s)
4709  {
4710  switch (c)
4711  {
4712  // quotation mark (0x22)
4713  case '"':
4714  {
4715  result[pos + 1] = '"';
4716  pos += 2;
4717  break;
4718  }
4719 
4720  // reverse solidus (0x5c)
4721  case '\\':
4722  {
4723  // nothing to change
4724  pos += 2;
4725  break;
4726  }
4727 
4728  // backspace (0x08)
4729  case '\b':
4730  {
4731  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
4732  pos += 2;
4733  break;
4734  }
4735 
4736  // formfeed (0x0c)
4737  case '\f':
4738  {
4739  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
4740  pos += 2;
4741  break;
4742  }
4743 
4744  // newline (0x0a)
4745  case '\n':
4746  {
4747  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
4748  pos += 2;
4749  break;
4750  }
4751 
4752  // carriage return (0x0d)
4753  case '\r':
4754  {
4755  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
4756  pos += 2;
4757  break;
4758  }
4759 
4760  // horizontal tab (0x09)
4761  case '\t':
4762  {
4763  result[pos + 1] = 't';
4764  pos += 2;
4765  break;
4766  }
4767 
4768  default:
4769  {
4770  if (c >= 0x00 and c <= 0x1f)
4771  {
4772  // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation (0..f)
4773  auto hexify = [](const char v) -> char
4774  {
4775  return (v < 10) ? ('0' + v) : ('a' + v - 10);
4776  };
4777 
4778  // print character c as \uxxxx
4779  for (const char m :
4780  { 'u', '0', '0', hexify(c >> 4), hexify(c & 0x0f)
4781  })
4782  {
4783  result[++pos] = m;
4784  }
4785 
4786  ++pos;
4787  }
4788  else
4789  {
4790  // all other characters are added as-is
4791  result[pos++] = c;
4792  }
4793  break;
4794  }
4795  }
4796  }
4797 
4798  return result;
4799  }
4800 
4801  /*!
4802  @brief internal implementation of the serialization function
4803 
4804  This function is called by the public member function dump and organizes
4805  the serializaion internally. The indentation level is propagated as
4806  additional parameter. In case of arrays and objects, the function is called
4807  recursively. Note that
4808 
4809  - strings and object keys are escaped using escape_string()
4810  - integer numbers are converted implictly via operator<<
4811  - floating-point numbers are converted to a string using "%g" format
4812 
4813  @param[out] o stream to write to
4814  @param[in] pretty_print whether the output shall be pretty-printed
4815  @param[in] indent_step the indent level
4816  @param[in] current_indent the current indent level (only used internally)
4817  */
4818  void dump(std::ostream& o, const bool pretty_print, const unsigned int indent_step,
4819  const unsigned int current_indent = 0) const
4820  {
4821  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
4822  unsigned int new_indent = current_indent;
4823 
4824  switch (m_type)
4825  {
4826  case (value_t::object):
4827  {
4828  if (m_value.object->empty())
4829  {
4830  o << "{}";
4831  return;
4832  }
4833 
4834  o << "{";
4835 
4836  // increase indentation
4837  if (pretty_print)
4838  {
4839  new_indent += indent_step;
4840  o << "\n";
4841  }
4842 
4843  for (auto i = m_value.object->cbegin(); i != m_value.object->cend(); ++i)
4844  {
4845  if (i != m_value.object->cbegin())
4846  {
4847  o << (pretty_print ? ",\n" : ",");
4848  }
4849  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') << "\""
4850  << escape_string(i->first) << "\":"
4851  << (pretty_print ? " " : "");
4852  i->second.dump(o, pretty_print, indent_step, new_indent);
4853  }
4854 
4855  // decrease indentation
4856  if (pretty_print)
4857  {
4858  new_indent -= indent_step;
4859  o << "\n";
4860  }
4861 
4862  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') + "}";
4863  return;
4864  }
4865 
4866  case (value_t::array):
4867  {
4868  if (m_value.array->empty())
4869  {
4870  o << "[]";
4871  return;
4872  }
4873 
4874  o << "[";
4875 
4876  // increase indentation
4877  if (pretty_print)
4878  {
4879  new_indent += indent_step;
4880  o << "\n";
4881  }
4882 
4883  for (auto i = m_value.array->cbegin(); i != m_value.array->cend(); ++i)
4884  {
4885  if (i != m_value.array->cbegin())
4886  {
4887  o << (pretty_print ? ",\n" : ",");
4888  }
4889  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ');
4890  i->dump(o, pretty_print, indent_step, new_indent);
4891  }
4892 
4893  // decrease indentation
4894  if (pretty_print)
4895  {
4896  new_indent -= indent_step;
4897  o << "\n";
4898  }
4899 
4900  o << string_t(new_indent, ' ') << "]";
4901  return;
4902  }
4903 
4904  case (value_t::string):
4905  {
4906  o << string_t("\"") << escape_string(*m_value.string) << "\"";
4907  return;
4908  }
4909 
4910  case (value_t::boolean):
4911  {
4912  o << (m_value.boolean ? "true" : "false");
4913  return;
4914  }
4915 
4916  case (value_t::number_integer):
4917  {
4918  o << m_value.number_integer;
4919  return;
4920  }
4921 
4922  case (value_t::number_float):
4923  {
4924  // 15 digits of precision allows round-trip IEEE 754
4925  // string->double->string; to be safe, we read this value from
4926  // std::numeric_limits<number_float_t>::digits10
4927  o << std::setprecision(std::numeric_limits<number_float_t>::digits10) << m_value.number_float;
4928  return;
4929  }
4930 
4931  case (value_t::discarded):
4932  {
4933  o << "<discarded>";
4934  return;
4935  }
4936 
4937  default:
4938  {
4939  o << "null";
4940  return;
4941  }
4942  }
4943  }
4944 
4945  private:
4946  //////////////////////
4947  // member variables //
4948  //////////////////////
4949 
4950  /// the type of the current element
4951  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
4952 
4953  /// the value of the current element
4954  json_value m_value = {};
4955 
4956 
4957  private:
4958  ///////////////
4959  // iterators //
4960  ///////////////
4961 
4962  /*!
4963  @brief an iterator for primitive JSON types
4964 
4965  This class models an iterator for primitive JSON types (boolean, number,
4966  string). It's only purpose is to allow the iterator/const_iterator classes
4967  to "iterate" over primitive values. Internally, the iterator is modeled by
4968  a `difference_type` variable. Value begin_value (`0`) models the begin,
4969  end_value (`1`) models past the end.
4970  */
4971  class primitive_iterator_t
4972  {
4973  public:
4974  /// set iterator to a defined beginning
4975  void set_begin()
4976  {
4977  m_it = begin_value;
4978  }
4979 
4980  /// set iterator to a defined past the end
4981  void set_end()
4982  {
4983  m_it = end_value;
4984  }
4985 
4986  /// return whether the iterator can be dereferenced
4987  bool is_begin() const
4988  {
4989  return (m_it == begin_value);
4990  }
4991 
4992  /// return whether the iterator is at end
4993  bool is_end() const
4994  {
4995  return (m_it == end_value);
4996  }
4997 
4998  /// return reference to the value to change and compare
4999  operator difference_type& ()
5000  {
5001  return m_it;
5002  }
5003 
5004  /// return value to compare
5005  operator difference_type () const
5006  {
5007  return m_it;
5008  }
5009 
5010  private:
5011  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
5012  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
5013 
5014  /// iterator as signed integer type
5015  difference_type m_it = std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::denorm_min();
5016  };
5017 
5018  /*!
5019  @brief an iterator value
5020 
5021  @note This structure could easily be a union, but MSVC currently does not
5022  allow unions members with complex constructors, see
5023  https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/105.
5024  */
5025  struct internal_iterator
5026  {
5027  /// iterator for JSON objects
5028  typename object_t::iterator object_iterator;
5029  /// iterator for JSON arrays
5030  typename array_t::iterator array_iterator;
5031  /// generic iterator for all other types
5032  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator;
5033 
5034  /// create an uninitialized internal_iterator
5035  internal_iterator()
5036  : object_iterator(), array_iterator(), primitive_iterator()
5037  {}
5038  };
5039 
5040  public:
5041  /*!
5042  @brief a const random access iterator for the @ref basic_json class
5043 
5044  This class implements a const iterator for the @ref basic_json class. From
5045  this class, the @ref iterator class is derived.
5046 
5047  @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
5048  - [RandomAccessIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/RandomAccessIterator):
5049  The iterator that can be moved to point (forward and backward) to any
5050  element in constant time.
5051  */
5052  class const_iterator : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, const basic_json>
5053  {
5054  /// allow basic_json to access private members
5055  friend class basic_json;
5056 
5057  public:
5058  /// the type of the values when the iterator is dereferenced
5059  using value_type = typename basic_json::value_type;
5060  /// a type to represent differences between iterators
5061  using difference_type = typename basic_json::difference_type;
5062  /// defines a pointer to the type iterated over (value_type)
5063  using pointer = typename basic_json::const_pointer;
5064  /// defines a reference to the type iterated over (value_type)
5065  using reference = typename basic_json::const_reference;
5066  /// the category of the iterator
5067  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
5068 
5069  /// default constructor
5070  const_iterator() = default;
5071 
5072  /// constructor for a given JSON instance
5073  const_iterator(pointer object) : m_object(object)
5074  {
5075  switch (m_object->m_type)
5076  {
5077  case (basic_json::value_t::object):
5078  {
5079  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
5080  break;
5081  }
5082  case (basic_json::value_t::array):
5083  {
5084  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
5085  break;
5086  }
5087  default:
5088  {
5089  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
5090  break;
5091  }
5092  }
5093  }

5096  const_iterator(const iterator& other) : m_object(other.m_object)
5097  {
5098  switch (m_object->m_type)
5099  {
5100  case (basic_json::value_t::object):
5101  {
5102  m_it.object_iterator = other.m_it.object_iterator;
5103  break;
5104  }
5105 
5106  case (basic_json::value_t::array):
5107  {
5108  m_it.array_iterator = other.m_it.array_iterator;
5109  break;
5110  }
5111 
5112  default:
5113  {

5115  break;
5116  }
5117  }

5119 
5120  /// copy constructor

5123  {}
5124 
5125  /// copy assignment

5127  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<pointer>::value and
5128  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<pointer>::value and
5129  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<internal_iterator>::value and
5130  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<internal_iterator>::value
5131  )
5132  {
5133  std::swap(m_object, other.m_object);
5134  std::swap(m_it, other.m_it);
5135  return *this;
5136  }

5138  private:

5143  {

5145  {

5147  break;
5148  }
5149 
5150  case (basic_json::value_t::array):
5151  {

5153  break;

5159  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
5160  break;

5164  {
5165  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
5166  break;
5167  }
5168  }
5169  }

5173  {
5174  switch (m_object->m_type)
5175  {
5176  case (basic_json::value_t::object):
5177  {
5178  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
5179  break;
5180  }
5181 
5182  case (basic_json::value_t::array):
5183  {
5184  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
5185  break;

5191  break;

5502  default:

5529  }

5534  reference value() const
5535  {

5537  }

5546  /*!
5547  @brief a mutable random access iterator for the @ref basic_json class
5548

5677  /*!
5678  @brief a template for a reverse iterator class
5679 
5680  @tparam Base the base iterator type to reverse. Valid types are @ref
5681  iterator (to create @ref reverse_iterator) and @ref const_iterator (to
5682  create @ref const_reverse_iterator).
5683 
5684  @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
5685  - [RandomAccessIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/RandomAccessIterator):
5686  The iterator that can be moved to point (forward and backward) to any
5687  element in constant time.
5688  - [OutputIterator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/concept/OutputIterator):
5689  It is possible to write to the pointed-to element (only if @a Base is
5690  @ref iterator).
5691  */
5692  template<typename Base>
5693  class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
5694  {
5695  public:
5696  /// shortcut to the reverse iterator adaptor
5697  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
5698  /// the reference type for the pointed-to element
5699  using reference = typename Base::reference;
5700 
5701  /// create reverse iterator from iterator
5702  json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it)
5703  : base_iterator(it) {}
5704 
5705  /// create reverse iterator from base class
5706  json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) : base_iterator(it) {}
5707 
5708  /// post-increment (it++)
5709  json_reverse_iterator operator++(int)
5710  {
5711  return base_iterator::operator++(1);
5712  }
5713 
5714  /// pre-increment (++it)
5715  json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
5716  {
5717  base_iterator::operator++();
5718  return *this;
5719  }
5720 
5721  /// post-decrement (it--)
5722  json_reverse_iterator operator--(int)
5723  {
5724  return base_iterator::operator--(1);
5725  }
5726 
5727  /// pre-decrement (--it)
5728  json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
5729  {
5730  base_iterator::operator--();
5731  return *this;
5732  }
5733 
5734  /// add to iterator
5735  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
5736  {
5737  base_iterator::operator+=(i);
5738  return *this;
5739  }
5740 
5741  /// add to iterator
5742  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
5743  {
5744  auto result = *this;
5745  result += i;
5746  return result;
5747  }
5748 
5749  /// subtract from iterator
5750  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
5751  {
5752  auto result = *this;
5753  result -= i;
5754  return result;
5755  }
5756 
5757  /// return difference
5758  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
5759  {
5760  return this->base() - other.base();
5761  }
5762 
5763  /// access to successor
5764  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
5765  {
5766  return *(this->operator+(n));
5767  }
5768 
5769  /// return the key of an object iterator
5770  typename object_t::key_type key() const
5771  {
5772  auto it = --this->base();
5773  return it.key();
5774  }
5775 
5776  /// return the value of an iterator
5777  reference value() const
5778  {
5779  auto it = --this->base();
5780  return it.operator * ();
5781  }
5782  };
5783 
5784  /*!
5785  @brief wrapper to access iterator member functions in range-based for
5786 
5787  This class allows to access @ref key() and @ref value() during range-based
5788  for loops. In these loops, a reference to the JSON values is returned, so
5789  there is no access to the underlying iterator.
5790  */
5791  class iterator_wrapper
5792  {
5793  private:
5794  /// the container to iterate
5795  basic_json& container;
5796  /// the type of the iterator to use while iteration
5797  using json_iterator = decltype(std::begin(container));
5798 
5799  /// internal iterator wrapper
5800  class iterator_wrapper_internal
5801  {
5802  private:
5803  /// the iterator
5804  json_iterator anchor;
5805  /// an index for arrays
5806  size_t array_index = 0;
5807 
5808  public:
5809  /// construct wrapper given an iterator
5810  iterator_wrapper_internal(json_iterator i) : anchor(i)
5811  {}
5812 
5813  /// dereference operator (needed for range-based for)
5814  iterator_wrapper_internal& operator*()
5815  {
5816  return *this;
5817  }
5818 
5819  /// increment operator (needed for range-based for)
5820  iterator_wrapper_internal& operator++()
5821  {
5822  ++anchor;
5823  ++array_index;
5824 
5825  return *this;
5826  }
5827 
5828  /// inequality operator (needed for range-based for)
5829  bool operator!= (const iterator_wrapper_internal& o)
5830  {
5831  return anchor != o.anchor;
5832  }
5833 
5834  /// return key of the iterator
5835  typename basic_json::string_t key() const
5836  {
5837  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
5838  {
5839  /// use integer array index as key
5840  case (value_t::array):
5841  {
5842  return std::to_string(array_index);
5843  }
5844 
5845  /// use key from the object
5846  case (value_t::object):
5847  {
5848  return anchor.key();
5849  }
5850 
5851  /// use an empty key for all primitive types
5852  default:
5853  {
5854  return "";
5855  }
5856  }
5857  }
5858 
5859  /// return value of the iterator
5860  typename json_iterator::reference value() const
5861  {
5862  return anchor.value();
5863  }
5864  };
5865 
5866  public:
5867  /// construct iterator wrapper from a container
5868  iterator_wrapper(basic_json& cont)
5869  : container(cont)
5870  {}
5871 
5872  /// return iterator begin (needed for range-based for)
5873  iterator_wrapper_internal begin()
5874  {
5875  return iterator_wrapper_internal(container.begin());
5876  }
5877 
5878  /// return iterator end (needed for range-based for)
5879  iterator_wrapper_internal end()
5880  {
5881  return iterator_wrapper_internal(container.end());
5882  }
5883  };
5884 
5885  private:
5886  //////////////////////
5887  // lexer and parser //
5888  //////////////////////
5889 
5890  /*!
5891  @brief lexical analysis
5892 
5893  This class organizes the lexical analysis during JSON deserialization. The
5894  core of it is a scanner generated by re2c <http://re2c.org> that processes
5895  a buffer and recognizes tokens according to RFC 7159.
5896  */
5897  class lexer
5898  {
5899  public:
5900  /// token types for the parser
5901  enum class token_type
5902  {
5903  uninitialized, ///< indicating the scanner is uninitialized
5904  literal_true, ///< the "true" literal
5905  literal_false, ///< the "false" literal
5906  literal_null, ///< the "null" literal
5907  value_string, ///< a string - use get_string() for actual value
5908  value_number, ///< a number - use get_number() for actual value
5909  begin_array, ///< the character for array begin "["
5910  begin_object, ///< the character for object begin "{"
5911  end_array, ///< the character for array end "]"
5912  end_object, ///< the character for object end "}"
5913  name_separator, ///< the name separator ":"
5914  value_separator, ///< the value separator ","
5915  parse_error, ///< indicating a parse error
5916  end_of_input ///< indicating the end of the input buffer
5917  };
5918 
5919  /// the char type to use in the lexer
5920  using lexer_char_t = unsigned char;
5921 
5922  /// constructor with a given buffer
5923  explicit lexer(const string_t& s) noexcept
5924  : m_stream(nullptr), m_buffer(s)
5925  {
5926  m_content = reinterpret_cast<const lexer_char_t*>(s.c_str());
5927  m_start = m_cursor = m_content;
5928  m_limit = m_content + s.size();
5929  }
5930  explicit lexer(std::istream* s) noexcept
5931  : m_stream(s), m_buffer()
5932  {
5933  getline(*m_stream, m_buffer);
5934  m_content = reinterpret_cast<const lexer_char_t*>(m_buffer.c_str());
5935  m_start = m_cursor = m_content;
5936  m_limit = m_content + m_buffer.size();
5937  }
5938 
5939  /// default constructor
5940  lexer() = default;
5941 
5942  // switch of unwanted functions
5943  lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
5944  lexer operator=(const lexer&) = delete;
5945 
5946  /*!
5947  @brief create a string from a Unicode code point
5948 
5949  @param[in] codepoint1 the code point (can be high surrogate)
5950  @param[in] codepoint2 the code point (can be low surrogate or 0)
5951  @return string representation of the code point
5952  @throw std::out_of_range if code point is >0x10ffff
5953  @throw std::invalid_argument if the low surrogate is invalid
5954 
5955  @see <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8#Sample_code>
5956  */
5957  static string_t to_unicode(const std::size_t codepoint1,
5958  const std::size_t codepoint2 = 0)
5959  {
5960  string_t result;
5961 
5962  // calculate the codepoint from the given code points
5963  std::size_t codepoint = codepoint1;
5964 
5965  // check if codepoint1 is a high surrogate
5966  if (codepoint1 >= 0xD800 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
5967  {
5968  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
5969  if (codepoint2 >= 0xDC00 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF)
5970  {
5971  codepoint =
5972  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
5973  (codepoint1 << 10)
5974  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
5975  + codepoint2
5976  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
5977  // in the result so we have to substract with:
5978  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
5979  - 0x35FDC00;
5980  }
5981  else
5982  {
5983  throw std::invalid_argument("missing or wrong low surrogate");
5984  }
5985  }
5986 
5987  if (codepoint < 0x80)
5988  {
5989  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
5990  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(codepoint));
5991  }
5992  else if (codepoint <= 0x7ff)
5993  {
5994  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
5995  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0xC0 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x1F)));
5996  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F)));
5997  }
5998  else if (codepoint <= 0xffff)
5999  {
6000  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
6001  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0xE0 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x0F)));
6002  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F)));
6003  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F)));
6004  }
6005  else if (codepoint <= 0x10ffff)
6006  {
6007  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
6008  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0xF0 | ((codepoint >> 18) & 0x07)));
6009  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F)));
6010  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F)));
6011  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F)));
6012  }
6013  else
6014  {
6015  throw std::out_of_range("code points above 0x10FFFF are invalid");
6016  }
6017 
6018  return result;
6019  }
6020 
6021  /// return name of values of type token_type
6022  static std::string token_type_name(token_type t)
6023  {
6024  switch (t)
6025  {
6026  case (token_type::uninitialized):
6027  return "<uninitialized>";
6028  case (token_type::literal_true):
6029  return "true literal";
6030  case (token_type::literal_false):
6031  return "false literal";
6032  case (token_type::literal_null):
6033  return "null literal";
6034  case (token_type::value_string):
6035  return "string literal";
6036  case (token_type::value_number):
6037  return "number literal";
6038  case (token_type::begin_array):
6039  return "[";
6040  case (token_type::begin_object):
6041  return "{";
6042  case (token_type::end_array):
6043  return "]";
6044  case (token_type::end_object):
6045  return "}";
6046  case (token_type::name_separator):
6047  return ":";
6048  case (token_type::value_separator):
6049  return ",";
6050  case (token_type::end_of_input):
6051  return "<end of input>";
6052  default:
6053  return "<parse error>";
6054  }
6055  }
6056 
6057  /*!
6058  This function implements a scanner for JSON. It is specified using
6059  regular expressions that try to follow RFC 7159 as close as possible.
6060  These regular expressions are then translated into a deterministic
6061  finite automaton (DFA) by the tool re2c <http://re2c.org>. As a result,
6062  the translated code for this function consists of a large block of code
6063  with goto jumps.
6064 
6065  @return the class of the next token read from the buffer
6066  */
6067  token_type scan() noexcept
6068  {
6069  // pointer for backtracking information
6070  m_marker = nullptr;
6071 
6072  // remember the begin of the token
6073  m_start = m_cursor;
6074 
6075 
6076  {
6077  lexer_char_t yych;
6078  unsigned int yyaccept = 0;
6079  static const unsigned char yybm[] =
6080  {
6081  0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0,
6082  0, 32, 32, 0, 0, 32, 0, 0,
6083  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6084  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6085  96, 64, 0, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6086  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6087  192, 192, 192, 192, 192, 192, 192, 192,
6088  192, 192, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6089  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6090  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6091  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6092  64, 64, 64, 64, 0, 64, 64, 64,
6093  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6094  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6095  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6096  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6097  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6098  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6099  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6100  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6101  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6102  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6103  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6104  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6105  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6106  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6107  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6108  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6109  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6110  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6111  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6112  64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64,
6113  };
6114  if ((m_limit - m_cursor) < 5)
6115  {
6116  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6117  }
6118  yych = *m_cursor;
6119  if (yych <= ':')
6120  {
6121  if (yych <= ' ')
6122  {
6123  if (yych <= '\n')
6124  {
6125  if (yych <= 0x00)
6126  {
6127  goto basic_json_parser_28;
6128  }
6129  if (yych <= 0x08)
6130  {
6131  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6132  }
6133  if (yych >= '\n')
6134  {
6135  goto basic_json_parser_4;
6136  }
6137  }
6138  else
6139  {
6140  if (yych == '\r')
6141  {
6142  goto basic_json_parser_2;
6143  }
6144  if (yych <= 0x1F)
6145  {
6146  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6147  }
6148  }
6149  }
6150  else
6151  {
6152  if (yych <= ',')
6153  {
6154  if (yych == '"')
6155  {
6156  goto basic_json_parser_27;
6157  }
6158  if (yych <= '+')
6159  {
6160  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6161  }
6162  goto basic_json_parser_16;
6163  }
6164  else
6165  {
6166  if (yych <= '/')
6167  {
6168  if (yych <= '-')
6169  {
6170  goto basic_json_parser_23;
6171  }
6172  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6173  }
6174  else
6175  {
6176  if (yych <= '0')
6177  {
6178  goto basic_json_parser_24;
6179  }
6180  if (yych <= '9')
6181  {
6182  goto basic_json_parser_26;
6183  }
6184  goto basic_json_parser_18;
6185  }
6186  }
6187  }
6188  }
6189  else
6190  {
6191  if (yych <= 'n')
6192  {
6193  if (yych <= ']')
6194  {
6195  if (yych == '[')
6196  {
6197  goto basic_json_parser_8;
6198  }
6199  if (yych <= '\\')
6200  {
6201  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6202  }
6203  goto basic_json_parser_10;
6204  }
6205  else
6206  {
6207  if (yych == 'f')
6208  {
6209  goto basic_json_parser_22;
6210  }
6211  if (yych <= 'm')
6212  {
6213  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6214  }
6215  goto basic_json_parser_20;
6216  }
6217  }
6218  else
6219  {
6220  if (yych <= '{')
6221  {
6222  if (yych == 't')
6223  {
6224  goto basic_json_parser_21;
6225  }
6226  if (yych <= 'z')
6227  {
6228  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6229  }
6230  goto basic_json_parser_12;
6231  }
6232  else
6233  {
6234  if (yych <= '}')
6235  {
6236  if (yych <= '|')
6237  {
6238  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6239  }
6240  goto basic_json_parser_14;
6241  }
6242  else
6243  {
6244  if (yych == 0xEF)
6245  {
6246  goto basic_json_parser_6;
6247  }
6248  goto basic_json_parser_30;
6249  }
6250  }
6251  }
6252  }
6253 basic_json_parser_2:
6254  ++m_cursor;
6255  yych = *m_cursor;
6256  goto basic_json_parser_5;
6257 basic_json_parser_3:
6258  {
6259  return scan();
6260  }
6261 basic_json_parser_4:
6262  ++m_cursor;
6263  if (m_limit <= m_cursor)
6264  {
6265  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6266  }
6267  yych = *m_cursor;
6268 basic_json_parser_5:
6269  if (yybm[0 + yych] & 32)
6270  {
6271  goto basic_json_parser_4;
6272  }
6273  goto basic_json_parser_3;
6274 basic_json_parser_6:
6275  yyaccept = 0;
6276  yych = *(m_marker = ++m_cursor);
6277  if (yych == 0xBB)
6278  {
6279  goto basic_json_parser_64;
6280  }
6281 basic_json_parser_7:
6282  {
6283  return token_type::parse_error;
6284  }

6287  {
6288  return token_type::begin_array;
6289  }

6294  }

6297  {
6298  return token_type::begin_object;
6299  }
6300 basic_json_parser_14:

6304  }

6317  yych = *(m_marker = ++m_cursor);

6321  }

6323 basic_json_parser_21:

6331 basic_json_parser_22:

6552  }
6553  yych = *m_cursor;
6554  if (yych <= '@')
6555  {
6556  if (yych <= '/')
6557  {
6558  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6559  }
6560  if (yych >= ':')
6561  {
6562  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6563  }
6564  }
6565  else
6566  {
6567  if (yych <= 'F')
6568  {
6569  goto basic_json_parser_39;
6570  }
6571  if (yych <= '`')
6572  {
6573  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6574  }
6575  if (yych >= 'g')
6576  {
6577  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6578  }
6579  }
6580 basic_json_parser_39:
6581  ++m_cursor;
6582  if (m_limit <= m_cursor)
6583  {
6584  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6585  }
6586  yych = *m_cursor;
6587  if (yych <= '@')
6588  {
6589  if (yych <= '/')
6590  {
6591  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6592  }
6593  if (yych >= ':')
6594  {
6595  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6596  }
6597  }
6598  else
6599  {
6600  if (yych <= 'F')
6601  {
6602  goto basic_json_parser_40;
6603  }
6604  if (yych <= '`')
6605  {
6606  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6607  }
6608  if (yych >= 'g')
6609  {
6610  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6611  }
6612  }
6613 basic_json_parser_40:
6614  ++m_cursor;
6615  if (m_limit <= m_cursor)
6616  {
6617  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6618  }
6619  yych = *m_cursor;
6620  if (yych <= '@')
6621  {
6622  if (yych <= '/')
6623  {
6624  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6625  }
6626  if (yych <= '9')
6627  {
6628  goto basic_json_parser_31;
6629  }
6630  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6631  }
6632  else
6633  {
6634  if (yych <= 'F')
6635  {
6636  goto basic_json_parser_31;
6637  }
6638  if (yych <= '`')
6639  {
6640  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6641  }
6642  if (yych <= 'f')
6643  {
6644  goto basic_json_parser_31;
6645  }
6646  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6647  }
6648 basic_json_parser_41:
6649  yyaccept = 1;
6650  m_marker = ++m_cursor;
6651  if ((m_limit - m_cursor) < 3)
6652  {
6653  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6654  }
6655  yych = *m_cursor;
6656 basic_json_parser_42:
6657  if (yybm[0 + yych] & 128)
6658  {
6659  goto basic_json_parser_41;
6660  }
6661  if (yych <= 'D')
6662  {
6663  if (yych != '.')
6664  {
6665  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6666  }
6667  }
6668  else
6669  {
6670  if (yych <= 'E')
6671  {
6672  goto basic_json_parser_44;
6673  }
6674  if (yych == 'e')
6675  {
6676  goto basic_json_parser_44;
6677  }
6678  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6679  }
6680 basic_json_parser_43:
6681  yych = *++m_cursor;
6682  if (yych <= '/')
6683  {
6684  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6685  }
6686  if (yych <= '9')
6687  {
6688  goto basic_json_parser_48;
6689  }
6690  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6691 basic_json_parser_44:
6692  yych = *++m_cursor;
6693  if (yych <= ',')
6694  {
6695  if (yych != '+')
6696  {
6697  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6698  }
6699  }
6700  else
6701  {
6702  if (yych <= '-')
6703  {
6704  goto basic_json_parser_45;
6705  }
6706  if (yych <= '/')
6707  {
6708  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6709  }
6710  if (yych <= '9')
6711  {
6712  goto basic_json_parser_46;
6713  }
6714  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6715  }
6716 basic_json_parser_45:
6717  yych = *++m_cursor;
6718  if (yych <= '/')
6719  {
6720  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6721  }
6722  if (yych >= ':')
6723  {
6724  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6725  }
6726 basic_json_parser_46:
6727  ++m_cursor;
6728  if (m_limit <= m_cursor)
6729  {
6730  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6731  }
6732  yych = *m_cursor;
6733  if (yych <= '/')
6734  {
6735  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6736  }
6737  if (yych <= '9')
6738  {
6739  goto basic_json_parser_46;
6740  }
6741  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6742 basic_json_parser_48:
6743  yyaccept = 1;
6744  m_marker = ++m_cursor;
6745  if ((m_limit - m_cursor) < 3)
6746  {
6747  yyfill(); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE;
6748  }
6749  yych = *m_cursor;
6750  if (yych <= 'D')
6751  {
6752  if (yych <= '/')
6753  {
6754  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6755  }
6756  if (yych <= '9')
6757  {
6758  goto basic_json_parser_48;
6759  }
6760  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6761  }
6762  else
6763  {
6764  if (yych <= 'E')
6765  {
6766  goto basic_json_parser_44;
6767  }
6768  if (yych == 'e')
6769  {
6770  goto basic_json_parser_44;
6771  }
6772  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6773  }
6774 basic_json_parser_50:
6775  yyaccept = 1;
6776  yych = *(m_marker = ++m_cursor);
6777  if (yych <= 'D')
6778  {
6779  if (yych == '.')
6780  {
6781  goto basic_json_parser_43;
6782  }
6783  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6784  }
6785  else
6786  {
6787  if (yych <= 'E')
6788  {
6789  goto basic_json_parser_44;
6790  }
6791  if (yych == 'e')
6792  {
6793  goto basic_json_parser_44;
6794  }
6795  goto basic_json_parser_25;
6796  }
6797 basic_json_parser_51:
6798  yych = *++m_cursor;
6799  if (yych != 'l')
6800  {
6801  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6802  }
6803  yych = *++m_cursor;
6804  if (yych != 's')
6805  {
6806  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6807  }
6808  yych = *++m_cursor;
6809  if (yych != 'e')
6810  {
6811  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6812  }
6813  ++m_cursor;
6814  {
6815  return token_type::literal_false;
6816  }
6817 basic_json_parser_56:
6818  yych = *++m_cursor;
6819  if (yych != 'u')
6820  {
6821  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6822  }
6823  yych = *++m_cursor;
6824  if (yych != 'e')
6825  {
6826  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6827  }
6828  ++m_cursor;
6829  {
6830  return token_type::literal_true;
6831  }
6832 basic_json_parser_60:
6833  yych = *++m_cursor;
6834  if (yych != 'l')
6835  {
6836  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6837  }
6838  yych = *++m_cursor;
6839  if (yych != 'l')
6840  {
6841  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6842  }
6843  ++m_cursor;
6844  {
6845  return token_type::literal_null;
6846  }
6847 basic_json_parser_64:
6848  yych = *++m_cursor;
6849  if (yych != 0xBF)
6850  {
6851  goto basic_json_parser_33;
6852  }
6853  ++m_cursor;
6854  {
6855  return scan();
6856  }
6857  }
6858 
6859 
6860  }
6861 
6862  /// append data from the stream to the internal buffer
6863  void yyfill() noexcept
6864  {
6865  if (not m_stream or not * m_stream)
6866  {
6867  return;
6868  }
6869 
6870  const ssize_t offset_start = m_start - m_content;
6871  const ssize_t offset_marker = m_marker - m_start;
6872  const ssize_t offset_cursor = m_cursor - m_start;
6873 
6874  m_buffer.erase(0, static_cast<size_t>(offset_start));
6875  std::string line;
6876  std::getline(*m_stream, line);
6877  m_buffer += "\n" + line; // add line with newline symbol
6878 
6879  m_content = reinterpret_cast<const lexer_char_t*>(m_buffer.c_str());
6880  m_start = m_content;
6881  m_marker = m_start + offset_marker;
6882  m_cursor = m_start + offset_cursor;
6883  m_limit = m_start + m_buffer.size() - 1;
6884  }
6885 
6886  /// return string representation of last read token
6887  string_t get_token() const noexcept
6888  {
6889  return string_t(reinterpret_cast<typename string_t::const_pointer>(m_start),
6890  static_cast<size_t>(m_cursor - m_start));
6891  }
6892 
6893  /*!
6894  @brief return string value for string tokens
6895 
6896  The function iterates the characters between the opening and closing
6897  quotes of the string value. The complete string is the range
6898  [m_start,m_cursor). Consequently, we iterate from m_start+1 to
6899  m_cursor-1.
6900 
6901  We differentiate two cases:
6902 
6903  1. Escaped characters. In this case, a new character is constructed
6904  according to the nature of the escape. Some escapes create new
6905  characters (e.g., @c "\\n" is replaced by @c "\n"), some are copied
6906  as is (e.g., @c "\\\\"). Furthermore, Unicode escapes of the shape
6907  @c "\\uxxxx" need special care. In this case, to_unicode takes care
6908  of the construction of the values.
6909  2. Unescaped characters are copied as is.
6910 
6911  @return string value of current token without opening and closing quotes
6912  @throw std::out_of_range if to_unicode fails
6913  */
6914  string_t get_string() const
6915  {
6916  string_t result;
6917  result.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(m_cursor - m_start - 2));
6918 
6919  // iterate the result between the quotes
6920  for (const lexer_char_t* i = m_start + 1; i < m_cursor - 1; ++i)
6921  {
6922  // process escaped characters
6923  if (*i == '\\')
6924  {
6925  // read next character
6926  ++i;
6927 
6928  switch (*i)
6929  {
6930  // the default escapes
6931  case 't':
6932  {
6933  result += "\t";
6934  break;
6935  }
6936  case 'b':
6937  {
6938  result += "\b";
6939  break;
6940  }
6941  case 'f':
6942  {
6943  result += "\f";
6944  break;
6945  }
6946  case 'n':
6947  {
6948  result += "\n";
6949  break;
6950  }
6951  case 'r':
6952  {
6953  result += "\r";
6954  break;
6955  }
6956  case '\\':
6957  {
6958  result += "\\";
6959  break;
6960  }
6961  case '/':
6962  {
6963  result += "/";
6964  break;
6965  }
6966  case '"':
6967  {
6968  result += "\"";
6969  break;
6970  }
6971 
6972  // unicode
6973  case 'u':
6974  {
6975  // get code xxxx from uxxxx
6976  auto codepoint = std::strtoul(std::string(reinterpret_cast<typename string_t::const_pointer>(i + 1),
6977  4).c_str(), nullptr, 16);
6978 
6979  // check if codepoint is a high surrogate
6980  if (codepoint >= 0xD800 and codepoint <= 0xDBFF)
6981  {
6982  // make sure there is a subsequent unicode
6983  if ((i + 6 >= m_limit) or * (i + 5) != '\\' or * (i + 6) != 'u')
6984  {
6985  throw std::invalid_argument("missing low surrogate");
6986  }
6987 
6988  // get code yyyy from uxxxx\uyyyy
6989  auto codepoint2 = std::strtoul(std::string(reinterpret_cast<typename string_t::const_pointer>
6990  (i + 7), 4).c_str(), nullptr, 16);
6991  result += to_unicode(codepoint, codepoint2);
6992  // skip the next 10 characters (xxxx\uyyyy)
6993  i += 10;
6994  }
6995  else
6996  {
6997  // add unicode character(s)
6998  result += to_unicode(codepoint);
6999  // skip the next four characters (xxxx)
7000  i += 4;
7001  }
7002  break;
7003  }
7004  }
7005  }
7006  else
7007  {
7008  // all other characters are just copied to the end of the
7009  // string
7010  result.append(1, static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(*i));
7011  }
7012  }
7013 
7014  return result;
7015  }
7016 
7017  /*!
7018  @brief return number value for number tokens
7019 
7020  This function translates the last token into a floating point number.
7021  The pointer m_start points to the beginning of the parsed number. We
7022  pass this pointer to std::strtod which sets endptr to the first
7023  character past the converted number. If this pointer is not the same as
7024  m_cursor, then either more or less characters have been used during the
7025  comparison. This can happen for inputs like "01" which will be treated
7026  like number 0 followed by number 1.
7027 
7028  @return the result of the number conversion or NAN if the conversion
7029  read past the current token. The latter case needs to be treated by the
7030  caller function.
7031 
7032  @throw std::range_error if passed value is out of range
7033  */
7034  long double get_number() const
7035  {
7036  // conversion
7037  typename string_t::value_type* endptr;
7038  const auto float_val = std::strtold(reinterpret_cast<typename string_t::const_pointer>(m_start),
7039  &endptr);
7040 
7041  // return float_val if the whole number was translated and NAN
7042  // otherwise
7043  return (reinterpret_cast<lexer_char_t*>(endptr) == m_cursor) ? float_val : NAN;
7044  }
7045 
7046  private:
7047  /// optional input stream
7048  std::istream* m_stream;
7049  /// the buffer
7050  string_t m_buffer;
7051  /// the buffer pointer
7052  const lexer_char_t* m_content = nullptr;
7053  /// pointer to the beginning of the current symbol
7054  const lexer_char_t* m_start = nullptr;
7055  /// pointer for backtracking information
7056  const lexer_char_t* m_marker = nullptr;
7057  /// pointer to the current symbol
7058  const lexer_char_t* m_cursor = nullptr;
7059  /// pointer to the end of the buffer
7060  const lexer_char_t* m_limit = nullptr;
7061  };
7062 
7063  /*!
7064  @brief syntax analysis
7065  */
7066  class parser
7067  {
7068  public:
7069  /// constructor for strings
7070  parser(const string_t& s, parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7071  : callback(cb), m_lexer(s)
7072  {
7073  // read first token
7074  get_token();
7075  }
7076 
7077  /// a parser reading from an input stream
7078  parser(std::istream& _is, parser_callback_t cb = nullptr)
7079  : callback(cb), m_lexer(&_is)
7080  {
7081  // read first token
7082  get_token();
7083  }
7084 
7085  /// public parser interface
7086  basic_json parse()
7087  {
7088  basic_json result = parse_internal(true);
7089 
7090  expect(lexer::token_type::end_of_input);
7091 
7092  // return parser result and replace it with null in case the
7093  // top-level value was discarded by the callback function
7094  return result.is_discarded() ? basic_json() : result;
7095  }
7096 
7097  private:
7098  /// the actual parser
7099  basic_json parse_internal(bool keep)
7100  {
7101  auto result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
7102 
7103  switch (last_token)
7104  {
7105  case (lexer::token_type::begin_object):
7106  {
7107  if (keep and (not callback or (keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::object_start, result))))
7108  {
7109  // explicitly set result to object to cope with {}
7110  result.m_type = value_t::object;
7111  result.m_value = json_value(value_t::object);
7112  }
7113 
7114  // read next token
7115  get_token();
7116 
7117  // closing } -> we are done
7118  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_object)
7119  {
7120  get_token();
7121  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
7122  {
7123  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
7124  }
7125  return result;
7126  }
7127 
7128  // no comma is expected here
7129  unexpect(lexer::token_type::value_separator);
7130 
7131  // otherwise: parse key-value pairs
7132  do
7133  {
7134  // ugly, but could be fixed with loop reorganization
7135  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
7136  {
7137  get_token();
7138  }
7139 
7140  // store key
7141  expect(lexer::token_type::value_string);
7142  const auto key = m_lexer.get_string();
7143 
7144  bool keep_tag = false;
7145  if (keep)
7146  {
7147  if (callback)
7148  {
7149  basic_json k(key);
7150  keep_tag = callback(depth, parse_event_t::key, k);
7151  }
7152  else
7153  {
7154  keep_tag = true;
7155  }
7156  }
7157 
7158  // parse separator (:)
7159  get_token();
7160  expect(lexer::token_type::name_separator);
7161 
7162  // parse and add value
7163  get_token();
7164  auto value = parse_internal(keep);
7165  if (keep and keep_tag and not value.is_discarded())
7166  {
7167  result[key] = std::move(value);
7168  }
7169  }
7170  while (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator);
7171 
7172  // closing }
7173  expect(lexer::token_type::end_object);
7174  get_token();
7175  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
7176  {
7177  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
7178  }
7179 
7180  return result;
7181  }
7182 
7183  case (lexer::token_type::begin_array):
7184  {
7185  if (keep and (not callback or (keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::array_start, result))))
7186  {
7187  // explicitly set result to object to cope with []
7188  result.m_type = value_t::array;
7189  result.m_value = json_value(value_t::array);
7190  }
7191 
7192  // read next token
7193  get_token();
7194 
7195  // closing ] -> we are done
7196  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::end_array)
7197  {
7198  get_token();
7199  if (callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
7200  {
7201  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
7202  }
7203  return result;
7204  }
7205 
7206  // no comma is expected here
7207  unexpect(lexer::token_type::value_separator);
7208 
7209  // otherwise: parse values
7210  do
7211  {
7212  // ugly, but could be fixed with loop reorganization
7213  if (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator)
7214  {
7215  get_token();
7216  }
7217 
7218  // parse value
7219  auto value = parse_internal(keep);
7220  if (keep and not value.is_discarded())
7221  {
7222  result.push_back(std::move(value));
7223  }
7224  }
7225  while (last_token == lexer::token_type::value_separator);
7226 
7227  // closing ]
7228  expect(lexer::token_type::end_array);
7229  get_token();
7230  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
7231  {
7232  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
7233  }
7234 
7235  return result;
7236  }
7237 
7238  case (lexer::token_type::literal_null):
7239  {
7240  get_token();
7241  result.m_type = value_t::null;
7242  break;
7243  }
7244 
7245  case (lexer::token_type::value_string):
7246  {
7247  const auto s = m_lexer.get_string();
7248  get_token();
7249  result = basic_json(s);
7250  break;
7251  }
7252 
7253  case (lexer::token_type::literal_true):
7254  {
7255  get_token();
7256  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
7257  result.m_value = true;
7258  break;
7259  }
7260 
7261  case (lexer::token_type::literal_false):
7262  {
7263  get_token();
7264  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
7265  result.m_value = false;
7266  break;
7267  }
7268 
7269  case (lexer::token_type::value_number):
7270  {
7271  auto float_val = m_lexer.get_number();
7272 
7273  // NAN is returned if token could not be translated
7274  // completely
7275  if (std::isnan(float_val))
7276  {
7277  throw std::invalid_argument(std::string("parse error - ") +
7278  m_lexer.get_token() + " is not a number");
7279  }
7280 
7281  get_token();
7282 
7283  // check if conversion loses precision
7284  const auto int_val = static_cast<number_integer_t>(float_val);
7285  if (approx(float_val, static_cast<long double>(int_val)))
7286  {
7287  // we basic_json not lose precision -> return int
7288  result.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
7289  result.m_value = int_val;
7290  }
7291  else
7292  {
7293  // we would lose precision -> returnfloat
7294  result.m_type = value_t::number_float;
7295  result.m_value = static_cast<number_float_t>(float_val);
7296  }
7297  break;
7298  }
7299 
7300  default:
7301  {
7302  // the last token was unexpected
7303  unexpect(last_token);
7304  }
7305  }
7306 
7307  if (keep and callback and not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result))
7308  {
7309  result = basic_json(value_t::discarded);
7310  }
7311  return result;
7312  }
7313 
7314  /// get next token from lexer
7315  typename lexer::token_type get_token()
7316  {
7317  last_token = m_lexer.scan();
7318  return last_token;
7319  }
7320 
7321  void expect(typename lexer::token_type t) const
7322  {
7323  if (t != last_token)
7324  {
7325  std::string error_msg = "parse error - unexpected \'";
7326  error_msg += m_lexer.get_token();
7327  error_msg += "\' (" + lexer::token_type_name(last_token);
7328  error_msg += "); expected " + lexer::token_type_name(t);
7329  throw std::invalid_argument(error_msg);
7330  }
7331  }
7332 
7333  void unexpect(typename lexer::token_type t) const
7334  {
7335  if (t == last_token)
7336  {
7337  std::string error_msg = "parse error - unexpected \'";
7338  error_msg += m_lexer.get_token();
7339  error_msg += "\' (";
7340  error_msg += lexer::token_type_name(last_token) + ")";
7341  throw std::invalid_argument(error_msg);
7342  }
7343  }
7344 
7345  private:
7346  /// current level of recursion
7347  int depth = 0;
7348  /// callback function
7349  parser_callback_t callback;
7350  /// the type of the last read token
7351  typename lexer::token_type last_token = lexer::token_type::uninitialized;
7352  /// the lexer
7353  lexer m_lexer;
7354  };
7355 };
7356

7364

7366 the standard template types.
7367 */
7368 // using json = basic_json<>;
7369 }

7376 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
7377 namespace std
7378 {
7379 /*!
7380 @brief exchanges the values of two JSON objects
7381 */
7382 template <>
7383 inline void swap(Sgt::json& j1,
7384  Sgt::json& j2) noexcept(
7385  is_nothrow_move_constructible<Sgt::json>::value and
7386  is_nothrow_move_assignable<Sgt::json>::value
7387  )
7388 {
7389  j1.swap(j2);
7390 }
7391 
7392 /// hash value for JSON objects
7393 template <>
7394 struct hash<Sgt::json>
7395 {
7396  /// return a hash value for a JSON object
7397  std::size_t operator()(const Sgt::json& j) const
7398  {
7399  // a naive hashing via the string representation
7400  const auto& h = hash<Sgt::json::string_t>();
7401  return h(j.dump());
7402  }
7403 };
7404 }
7405 
7406 /*!
7407 @brief user-defined string literal for JSON values
7408 
7409 This operator implements a user-defined string literal for JSON objects. It can
7410 be used by adding \p "_json" to a string literal and returns a JSON object if
7411 no parse error occurred.
7412 
7413 @param[in] s a string representation of a JSON object
7414 @return a JSON object
7415 */
7416 inline Sgt::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t)
7417 {
7418  return Sgt::json::parse(reinterpret_cast<Sgt::json::string_t::value_type*>
7419  (const_cast<char*>(s)));
7420 }
7421
